titlestmt.titleproper: Finding Aid for Golden C. Bahr papers 1918-1919.
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Len Coombs

publicationstmt.publisher: Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

profiledesc.creation: Encoded finding aid created by Len Coombs 2002-08
profiledesc.langusage: The finding aid is written in English.

change.item: Converted to EAD2002 using Word macro and Xmetal.
Original encoding in EAD ver. 1.0 from Word 6.0 file using word macros and manual tagging in A/E.

titlepage.publisher:
Michigan Historical Collections
Bentley Historical Library
University of Michigan
titlepage.titleproper:
Finding Aid for
Golden C. Bahr papers, 1918-1919.
titlepage.author:
Finding aid prepared by:
Len Coombs

did.abstract: Soldier from Copemish, Mich., member of 339th U.S. Infantry who served in the Allied intervention in Russia, 1918-1920, the "Polar Bear Expedition." Collection includes letter (Nov.13, 1918) to his parents (censored); photocopies of his military records and newspaper articles about him; photocopy of photograph of flowers and flag at his funeral; and photograph of his gravestone.

repository.corpname: Bentley Historical Library University of Michigan

acqinfo.p: The collection was donated by Mrs. Donna B. Willett, of Alpena, Michigan, in 1999-2000 (Donor no.: 4757).

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

prefercite.p: item, folder title, Golden C. Bahr papers, Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

bioghist.p: Resident of Copemish, Mich., who served with the 339th U.S. Infantry in Russia in 1918-1919.

scopecontent.p: Letter (Nov. 13, 1918) to his parents (censored); photocopies of his military records and newspaper articles about him; photocopy of photograph of flowers and flag at his funeral; and photograph of his gravestone.
